title: Activating Cities
synopsis: thoughts on slow cook for two days

title: autre Web
synopsis: Ce qui arrive sur FedWiki, c'est une continuation de certains rêves de ce qu'aurait pu être le web — qui découle du [[Xanadu Project]] de Ted Wilson, d'[[Hypercard]] et du Memex de Wannevar Bush.

title: Emotional Dictionary
synopsis: The idea here is to curate a [[radio conference]] on emotions, or emotional health. Can we look at mental health from a positive perspective? Can we explore the diversity of reactions to emotional situations? Let's collect some ideas and research around this subject.

title: FEAST
synopsis: [[FEAST]] is a global decentralised conference and music festival, connected by radio. It is a celebration of local culture, with communities connected globally through conversation, sound and music.

title: FEAST Activity
synopsis: This form of writing and co-creation that we explore is new. It is an unusual and new way to collaborate, one which encourages us to share our early thoughts as we see them pass from hand to hand. This process we have called before [[Writing With Strangers]].

title: François Guerroué
synopsis: François s'est réclamé a Pigny du penseur Murray Bookchin. Dont acte.

title: Hypercard
synopsis: [https://arstechnica.com/apple/2012/05/25-years-of-hypercard-the-missing-link-to-the-web/2/ 25 years of HyperCard—the missing link to the Web (Wired)]

title: Noam Norkhat
synopsis: A translater, aspiring poet and muscle-for-hire.

title: Pigny
synopsis: Pigny is a commune in the Cher department in the Centre region of France - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pigny wikipedia]

title: Radio Conference
synopsis: Radio as we understand it today is a broadcast medium. Conferences are events that take place in physical space. Both allow only limited forms of dialogue and questioning from the audience. FEAST aims to create an entirely new form of radio show and dialogue with the audience.

title: Semantic Network
synopsis: A semantic network is a graphic notation for representing knowledge in patterns of interconnected nodes and arcs. It is one way for knowledge visualization and presentation.

title: Things heard around the work table
synopsis: Working with FedWiki — things heard on the 03/15/17

title: Vigny
synopsis: The even will take place mid-may 2017 and gather writers, artists, librarian and philosophers to discuss Yuk Hui's [[Archivist Manifesto]], explore new tools to build and share knowledge. To reflect on the politics of archiving, the set of practices it englobes, reveals and hides.

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Follow [[changes to this site]] or [[FEAST activity]] to see what we're working on.

title: Xanadu Project
synopsis: Au sujet du Xanadu Project, quelques liens
